Key Match Events: Patrik Schick cancelled out Georges Mikautadzeâ€™s strike with an equalising goal in the 58th minute.
Georgia took a deserved lead on the stroke of half-time with a penalty converted calmly by Georges Mikautadze.
What drama at the end as Georgia break with a three on one. The shot at the end is put over the bar and the final kick of the game could have won the game for Georgia.
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia complete their group stage with a match against Portugal, while Czech Republic play Turkey.
The draw leaves both sides on one point, having played two matches. Portugal and Turkey - who play later - are on three each.
Post-Match Reflections: A Patrik Schick goal spared the blushes of Czech Republic as they played out a frantic 1-1 draw against Georgia at the Volksparkstadion.
The result means both teams go into the final round of group games at Euro 2024 capable of qualifying for the last 16.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The West Ham defender Vladimir Coufal was dominant on and off the ball throughout the game.
The Czech Republic team will be disappointed that they could not take advantage of the tired and leggy Georgian defence to register their first win at the tournament.
Others: The match was played at the Volksparkstadion in Euro 2024 Group F.
The match highlights included a disallowed goal for Czech Republic in the 23rd minute and a missed chance for Georgia at the end of the game.
